categories.title: Recent Updates to the Eliza Project

content.text:
The Eliza project has seen significant development activity with numerous feature additions, bug fixes, and infrastructure improvements.

New plugins have been added to expand functionality:
- A client-agnostic Devin plugin (#2549)
- Lightning plugin (#2429)
- NVIDIA NIM plugin (#2599)
- Holdstation swap plugin (#2596)
- Router Nitro plugin (#2590)
- Cronos EVM plugin (#2585)
- Initia plugin (#2448)
- 0x plugin for swapping on EVMs (#2329)
- More actions added to Abstract Plugin (#2531)

Vision and language capabilities were enhanced with:
- Anthropic image provider for vision (#2524)
- Three new languages added to TTS (#2562)
- Improved X Spaces functionality that waits for silence rather than mute (#2576)

Developer experience improvements include:
- Added functionality to create, store, and restore agents in the filesystem (#2389)
- Updated README with prerequisites for enabling Telegram bot (#2547)
- Fixed build/start issues on the develop branch (#2545, #2546)
- Added test configuration for client-lens (#2534) and other plugins (#2573, #2567)
- Improved integration tests workflow with better caching (#2589)
- Fixed incorrect boolean parsing for OPEN_AI_COMMUNITY_PLUGIN setting (#2560)
- Added instructions to escape quotes on JSON generation (#2604)

Infrastructure changes:
- PNPM cache configuration optimized and then reverted (#2555, #2556)
- Cleanup step removed from integration tests workflow (#2551, #2553)
- Security updates to Vite dependency (#2627, #2629)
- Added 'node-compile-cache' to '.gitignore' (#2597)

Documentation was also updated with "What Did You Get Done This Week? #10" notes (#2558).

categories.title: Recent Issues in elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text: Several users have reported connectivity and startup issues with the elizaOS/eliza project. The Telegram client is not working or responding (issue #2557), and the chat client has unstable connections with errors like 'ERR_BLOCKED_BY_CLIENT' (issue #2540). Users are also experiencing problems with agent lists not displaying properly.

There are multiple startup and initialization errors being reported. These include incorrect OpenAI errors on clean starts (issue #2569), inability to start due to being stuck downloading the fast-bge-small-en-v1.5 model (issue #2623), and errors where the code cannot find the index.js file in the client-direct/dist folder (issue #2613).

Integration issues have also been reported, including problems connecting to GROQ (issue #2622) and a request for integrating searxng (issue #2565). Additionally, the '@elizaos/agent' package cannot be installed (issue #2624), and there's a functionality issue where the command to switch characters (pnpm start -- -- --character=characters/trump.character.json) no longer works (issue #2592).
There is also a generic 'Fix error' issue (#2578) without specific details about the nature of the problem.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
The elizaOS/eliza repository has seen several new pull requests focused on plugin development and system improvements. Notable additions include:

- A client-agnostic Devin plugin (PR #2549)
- A Truth Social plugin (PR #2537)
- A CoinGecko plugin for cryptocurrency data (PR #1382)
- A Chainbase plugin (PR #2586)
- A MongoDB adapter (PR #2605)

There have also been technical fixes such as package.json updates to support multiple React versions (PR #2574), and significant releases including SIMSAI OFFICIAL RELEASE (PR #2614) and Release/v1.1-edits (PR #2607).

These pull requests demonstrate ongoing development to expand the platform's capabilities through new integrations and technical improvements.

Current cryptocurrency prices:

WETH: The price has increased from $3,212.30 to $3,279.15, showing a positive movement of approximately 2.1%.

SOL: The price has slightly decreased from $244.19 to $241.86, a decline of about 0.95%.

WBTC: The price has risen from $101,059.37 to $101,918.62, an increase of roughly 0.85%.

ai16z: The price has significantly increased from $0.80 to $0.93, representing a substantial gain of approximately 16.7%.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 20-21, 2025, there were 31 new pull requests with 13 merged, 11 new issues created, and 50 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (January 21-22, 2025) with 29 new pull requests (19 merged), 18 new issues, and a jump to 66 active contributors. Overall, the project saw growth in both contribution volume and contributor count between these two consecutive days.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
